metadata.name: Portable Gpg.EXE Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of "gpg.exe" from uncommon location. Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\gpg.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\gpg2.exe'))) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('gpg.exe') AND lower(device.desc) = lower('gnupg’s openpgp tool') AND NOT (contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\program files (x86)\\gnu\\gnupg\\bin\\')) OR contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\program files (x86)\\gnupg vs-desktop\\')) OR contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\program files (x86)\\gnupg\\bin\\')) OR contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\program files (x86)\\gpg4win\\bin\\'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of "gpg.exe" from uncommon location. Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.
